content: Get browser extensions to remove irrelevant Youtube recommendations.
Block third-parties cookies on your social media to stop advertisers from tracking your every move. Save battery life and data by keeping your browsing private.
Youtube is a great place to start, but not only rely on youtube for all your information. Find other sources of information.
Be super specific with your search keywords to get relevant information.
Watch out and recognize the odd and unrelated search results
Thumbnails and titles can be alluring to click but reposting old content doesn’t mean they’re relevant to current events. So beware of old and repetitive content.
Check the comments to understand whether the content is worth-watching.

If there are unnecessary video recommendations, the viewer can click on the three-dot icon and select 'Not interested' to only remove that particular video or 'Don't recommend channel' to remove all further video suggestions from the recommended videos section.
It takes time and effort to create genuine  content, and a constant support to keep generating new ones. So, be sure to figure out where this support is coming from and why.

Youtube suggests content according to their algorithm and there's no accountability to anyone. It falls on the viewer to try and fact check a video for how credible it actually is because generally if something is too good to be true, it actually is.
If the content seems inappropriate, click on the bottom right, three dot, and report the video.
Delete your Youtube profile’s search and watch history.
